sen.j: 芝山家（しばやまけ）は、藤原北家高藤流勧修寺庶流の堂上家、家格は、名家。
sen.e: The Shibayama family was a "Tosho-ke" (the hereditary lineage of Court nobles occupying relatively high ranks) of an illegitimate family lineage of Kajuji of the Takafuji group of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, and its social standing was a prestigious family.

sen.j: 右京亮・阿部致康（准大臣・勧修寺晴豊の五男）の実子である大蔵卿・勧修寺宣豊が、叔父である権大納言・勧修寺光豊の猶子となり、芝山を称したのにはじまる。
sen.e: The family was started when Okura-kyo (Minister of the Treasury) Nobutoyo KAJUJI, a biological child of Ukyo no suke (Assistant Master of the Western Capital Offices) Okiyasu ABE (who was the fifth son of Haretoyo a Jun-daijin (Vice Minister) Haretoyo KAJUJI) was adopted by his uncle Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) Mitsutoyo KAJUJI and was named SHIBAYAMA.

sen.j: 芝山とは元々勧修寺家の別称であり、勧修寺家初代、内大臣・勧修寺経顕も芝山内大臣と称した。
sen.e: Originally, Shibayama was an another name of a KAJUJI family, and the first family head of the KAJUJI family, Naidaijin (minister of the center) Tsuneaki KAJUJI was also called as Naidaijin Shibayama.

sen.j: 初代・権大納言・芝山宣豊以降、代々歌道を業とし、江戸時代の石高は、蔵米100石であった。
sen.e: After the first family head, Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) Nobutoyo SHIBAYAMA, waka poetry had been their family business for generations, and they had 100 Goku crop yields of rice in Edo period.

sen.j: 10代・芝山慶豊で明治に至り華族に列し子爵に叙せられた。
sen.e: In Meiji Era, the tenth family head was Yoshitoyo SHIBAYAMA, and the family was raised to the peerage and viscount.

sen.j: 明治元年（1868年）、8代・宮内大輔・芝山国典の養子（実は参議・坊城俊政の子）で、興福寺賢聖院住持の国映が復飾して「今園家」を興した。
sen.e: In 1868, the eighth family head, Kudai-taifu (post of Imperial Household Ministry) Kuninori SHIBAYAMA's adopted son Kokuei, who was the chief priest of Kofuku-ji Kensho-in Temple (also a son of Sangi (councillor) Toshimasa BOJO), created the Imazono family after exclaustration.

sen.e: SHIBAYAMA, his adoptive mother and the lawful wife of the nineth family head Minbu taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs) Yoshitoyo SHIBAYAMA, temporary succeeded the headship of the family.
